title: Building Rust with --enable-ccache fails on Windows (MSYS2)
body:
I'm not yet sure who is to blame - ccache, LLVM, Rust or me, but still reporting just in case.
Here's the firing assert in ccache code https://github.com/jrosdahl/ccache/blob/master/util.c#L1355
cc @pnkfelix 

```
$ make VERBOSE=1
cfg: version 1.3.0-dev (21dd4e2a0 2015-06-24)
cfg: build triple x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: host triples x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: target triples x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
cfg: host for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu is x86_64
cfg: os for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu is pc-windows-gnu
cfg: good valgrind for x86_64-pc-windows-gnu is
cfg: using CC=ccache clang (CFG_CC)
cfg: using CXX=clang++ (CFG_CXX)
cfg: disabling valgrind run-pass tests
cfg: no xelatex found, disabling LaTeX docs
cfg: no pandoc found, omitting PDF and EPUB docs
make -C /home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm  ONLY_TOOLS="bugpoint llc llvm-ar llvm-as llvm-dis llvm-mc opt llvm-extract"
make[1]: Entering directory '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm'
for dir in lib/Support lib/TableGen utils lib/IR lib tools/llvm-config tools cmake; do \
  if ([ ! -f $dir/Makefile ] || \
      command test $dir/Makefile -ot /home/we/rust/src/llvm/$dir/Makefile ); then \
    /home/we/rust/src/llvm/autoconf/mkinstalldirs $dir; \
    /usr/bin/cp /home/we/rust/src/llvm/$dir/Makefile $dir/Makefile; \
  fi; \
  (make -C $dir all ) || exit 1; \
done
make[2]: Entering directory '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support'
llvm[2]: Compiling APFloat.cpp for Release build
if  ccache clang++ -Qunused-arguments -I/home/we/rust/src/llvm/include -I/home/we/rust/src/llvm/lib/Support -I/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/include -I/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support  -DNDEBUG -D__NO_CTYPE_INLINE -D_GNU_SOURCE -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS -O2 -fomit-frame-pointer -std=gnu++11 -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -fno-exceptions -fno-rtti -Wcast-qual    -Wall -W -Wno-unused-parameter -Wwrite-strings -Wcovered-switch-default -Wno-uninitialized -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-comment -c -MMD -MP -MF "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d.tmp" -MT "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o" -MT "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d" /home/we/rust/src/llvm/lib/Support/APFloat.cpp -o /home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o ; \
        then /usr/bin/mv -f "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d.tmp" "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d"; else /usr/bin/rm "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d.tmp"; exit 1; fi

This application has requested the Runtime to terminate it in an unusual way.
Please contact the application's support team for more information.
Assertion failed!

Program: C:\msys64\mingw64\bin\ccache.exe
File: ../ccache/util.c, Line 1176

Expression: from && from[0] == '/'
/usr/bin/rm: cannot remove ‘/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d.tmp’: No such file or directory
/home/we/rust/src/llvm/Makefile.rules:1521: recipe for target '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o' failed
make[2]: *** [/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o] Error 1
make[2]: Leaving directory '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support'
/home/we/rust/src/llvm/Makefile.rules:880: recipe for target 'all' failed
make[1]: *** [all] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm'
/home/we/rust/mk/llvm.mk:89: recipe for target '/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/Release/bin/llvm-config.exe' failed
make: *** [/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/Release/bin/llvm-config.exe] Error 2
```

Curiously, copy-pasting and running

```
ccache clang++ -Qunused-arguments -I/home/we/rust/src/llvm/include -I/home/we/rust/src/llvm/lib/Support -I/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/include -I/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support  -DNDEBUG -D__NO_CTYPE_INLINE -D_GNU_SOURCE -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS -O2 -fomit-frame-pointer -std=gnu++11 -fvisibility-inlines-hidden -fno-exceptions -fno-rtti -Wcast-qual    -Wall -W -Wno-unused-parameter -Wwrite-strings -Wcovered-switch-default -Wno-uninitialized -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-comment -c -MMD -MP -MF "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d.tmp" -MT "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o" -MT "/home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.d" /home/we/rust/src/llvm/lib/Support/APFloat.cpp -o /home/we/rust/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/llvm/lib/Support/Release/APFloat.o
```

separately completes successfully, but subsequent runs of `make` repeat the error on the next file etc.
